active_learning.discussion_prompt: How would you apply this concept in your work environment?
active_learning.peer_teaching: In pairs, one student explains the TLS handshake process (ClientHello to key exchange) to their partner using drawings; partner teaches back cipher suite selection. Switch roles to address misconceptions like assuming all ciphers are equal.
active_learning.problem_solving: Provide students with a vulnerable server config (e.g., supports SSL 3.0, weak RC4 cipher). Using tools like OpenSSL or Qualys SSL Labs, reconfigure to NIST-compliant TLS 1.3-only setup. Real-world app: Secure a mock e-commerce site.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in Transport Layer Security (TLS) Configuration. Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Security Controls and Hardening > Cryptographic Controls Provisioning > Transport Layer Security (TLS) Configuration. Generate 50 high-quality flashcards (20 basic Q&A, 15 cloze deletions, 15 MCQ) optimized for Anki/Spaced Repetition. Cover all 4 scaffolding layers progressively (Layer 1: 20%, Layer 2: 25%, Layer 3: 30%, Layer 4: 25%). Align to these Bloom's Taxonomy objectives: 1. REMEMBER: Define TLS and list core properties. 2. UNDERSTAND: Explain handshake. 3. APPLY: Implement config. 4. ANALYZE: Identify vulnerabilities. 5. EVALUATE: Assess NIST compliance. 6. CREATE: Design policy. Incorporate active learning: Embed prompts referencing discussion (TLS 1.2 vs 1.3 debate), peer teaching (handshake drawings), problem-solving (fix vulnerable config). Key content from research/NIST: TLS/SSL definitions, handshake, cipher suites (prefer ECDHE, AESGCM; disable RC4, SSL3), PKI/certificates, NIST SP 800-52r2 (profiles, compliance), NIST SP 1800-16 (TLS cert mgmt, best practices like OCSP stapling, HSTS), TLS 1.3 optimizations, tools (OpenSSL, SSL Labs). Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards matching this schema: {'type': 'basic'|'cloze'|'mcq', 'front': str, 'back': str, 'explanation': str, 'tags': [str], 'distractors': [str] (MCQ only)}. Ensure variety: Basic for remember/understand, cloze for apply/analyze, MCQ for evaluate/create. Distractors: 3 plausible based on misconceptions (e.g., legacy protocols). Explanations: Cite sources, link to objectives/layers/active learning.
